creator: sotto+jk@mac.com
text:
Judging by the stack trace (see below), it looks like your JDK1.1 
compatibility code is using a ClassLoader method introduced in 1.2: 
getParent(). JSPs (such as /examples/jsp/snp/snoop.jsp) fail to compile 
running on my Mac (OS9.0.4, MRJ 2.2.5) with the following a 500 error, 
and the following stack trace:

java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: java.lang.ClassLoader: method 
getParent()Ljava/lang/ClassLoader; not found
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.compat.Jdk11Compat.getURLs(Compiled 
Code)
	at 
org.apache.tomcat.facade.JasperLiaison.computeClassPath(JspIntercep
tor.java:809)
	at 
org.apache.tomcat.facade.JasperLiaison.createCompilationContext(JspIn
terceptor.java:842)
	at 
org.apache.tomcat.facade.JasperLiaison.processJspFile(JspInterceptor.j
ava:617)
	at 
org.apache.tomcat.facade.JspInterceptor.requestMap(JspInterceptor.java:
437)
	at org.apache.tomcat.core.ContextManager.processRequest(Compiled 
Code)
	at org.apache.tomcat.core.ContextManager.internalService(Compiled 
Code)
	at org.apache.tomcat.core.ContextManager.service(Compiled Code)
	at 
org.apache.tomcat.modules.server.Http10Interceptor.processConnection(
Http10Interceptor.java:152)
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.net.TcpWorkerThread.runIt(Compiled Code)
	at 
org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.ThreadPool$ControlRunnable.run(Compil
ed Code)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java)

I am running Tomcat 3.3 right out of the box, except that I dropped the 
Struts examples into the webapps folder, and created a JBindery bindlet 
to replace the startup/shutdown scripts in the distribution.

creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com
text:
Fixed ( I'll commit it later tonight ). Thanks for the report, and please keep
checking with JDK1.1.
